MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate Parse(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified <see cref="T:System.String"> into a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate> object.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate"> object that is obtained from .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Parse method is capable of parsing strings in various formats. The recognizable string formats are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |yyyy|The year in 4-digit format.|1999, 1812| |MM|The numeric month. Single-digit months have a leading zero.|11, 05| |dd|The day of the month. Single-digit days have a leading zero.|23, 09| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, 08:00|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate> class.
[!CODE [System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate#11](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate#11)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the date and time of the current instance is positive or negative.
Docs.value: An integer that indicates whether <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDate.Value%2A> is positive or negative.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An integer of less than zero indicates a negative Sign.
